content.question: The figure above shows the graph of <math alttext="y equals, 5 x, minus x squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> and the line <math alttext="y equals 4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="0 less than or equal to x, less than or equal to 4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is the sum of the areas of the shaded regions?

topic.text: 8.6: Finding the Area Between Curves That Intersect at More Than Two Points

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Identify mathematical information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and/or verbal representations.
